New Records: Sean Manaea allowed only three hits and struck out six with two walks and two hit batters over seven-plus innings and 91 pitches, the best outing by a Mets starting pitcher this postseason.
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea mastered the Phillies with one run allowed over seven innings, carrying the Mets to a 7-2 victory in Game 3 of the NLDS.
Pete Alonso homered leading off the second to produce the game's first run.
Jesse Winker's homer with two outs in the fourth gave the Mets a 2-0 lead.
Starling Marte stroked a two-run single in the sixth that widened the gap to 4-0.
Jose Iglesias gave the Mets a cushion by swatting a two-run single in the bottom of the inning that extended the lead to 6-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza praised Sean Manaea's demeanor on the mound, saying he was always on the attack, from the first pitch.
Jose Iglesias said the whole team did a great job competing that inning, and it was pretty special.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets are now one win away from the NLCS.
The Mets have never clinched a postseason berth or series at home in the 16 seasons of Citi Field's existence.
Others: Sean Manaea blew a kiss to the sky (directed toward his Aunt Mabel, whom he learned had passed away earlier in the day) and disappeared into the first-base dugout.
Edmundo Sosa reached on an infield single leading off the eighth inning, and Sean Manaea was removed.
